This plugin enables the assignment of the Persistent Uniform Resource Locator to the issues, articles and galleys in OJS.
Please configure the PURL plugin to be able to manage and use PURLs in OJS:
Journal Content
Please choose the objects PURLs should be assigned to.
Please select the publishing objects that will have Persistent Uniform Resource Locator (PURL) assigned:
Issues
Articles
Galleys
PURL Prefix
The PURL prefix is the fix, never changing part of the PURL.
PURL Suffix
A PURL suffix can take any form, but must be unique among all publishing objects with the same PURL prefix assigned:

Use the pattern entered below to generate PURL suffixes. Use %j for journal initials, %v for the volume number, %i for the issue number, %s para el ID del número, %Y for the year, %a for the OJS article ID, %g for the OJS galley ID, %f for the OJS file ID, %p for the page number and %x for "Custom Identifier".
For example, vol%viss%ipp%p could create the PURL suffix "vol3iss2pp230".
